message.text: will changing keymaps will work after uninstalling powertoys

parts.text: will changing keymaps will work after uninstalling powertoys

response.value: No, changing keymaps with PowerToys will not persist after uninstalling PowerToys. PowerToys remaps keys at the software level, and uninstalling it will revert your keyboard to its default behavior. If you want permanent keymap changes, consider using Windows registry edits or third-party tools that apply changes at a lower level.

toolCallRounds.response: No, changing keymaps with PowerToys will not persist after uninstalling PowerToys. PowerToys remaps keys at the software level, and uninstalling it will revert your keyboard to its default behavior. If you want permanent keymap changes, consider using Windows registry edits or third-party tools that apply changes at a lower level.

metadata.helpTextPrefix: You can ask me general programming questions, or chat with the following participants which have specialized expertise and can perform actions:

helpTextPostfix.value:
To have a great conversation, ask me questions as if I was a real programmer:

* **Show me the code** you want to talk about by having the files open and selecting the most important lines.
* **Make refinements** by asking me follow-up questions, adding clarifications, providing errors, etc.
* **Review my suggested code** and tell me about issues or improvements, so I can iterate on it.

You can also ask me questions about your editor selection by [starting an inline chat session](command:inlineChat.start).

Learn more about [GitHub Copilot](https://docs.github.com/copilot/using-github-copilot/getting-started-with-github-copilot?tool=vscode&utm_source=editor&utm_medium=chat-panel&utm_campaign=2024q3-em-MSFT-getstarted) in [Visual Studio Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/overview). Or explore the [Copilot walkthrough](command:github.copilot.open.walkthrough).

message.text: i want to change my capslock to escape and disaple escape button using regedit can u help me

parts.text: i want to change my capslock to escape and disaple escape button using regedit can u help me

response.value:
Yes, you can remap keys using the Windows Registry with **Scancode Map**. Here’s how to remap **Caps Lock** to **Escape** and disable the **Escape** key:

### Steps

1. **Open Registry Editor**  
   Press `Win + R`, type `regedit`, and press Enter.

2. **Navigate to the Key**  
   Go to:  
   ```
   HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Keyboard Layout
   ```

3. **Add Scancode Map**  
   Right-click in the right pane, choose **New > Binary Value**, name it `Scancode Map`.

4. **Set the Value**  
   Double-click `Scancode Map` and enter the following value:

   ```
   00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00
   03 00 00 00
   01 00 3A 00   ; Caps Lock (0x3A) → Escape (0x01)
   00 00 01 00   ; Disable Escape (0x01 → 0x00)
   00 00 00 00   ; End of map
   ```

   In hex (paste into the editor as one line):

   ```
   00000000000000000300000001003A000000010000000000
   ```

5. **Restart Your Computer**  
   Changes take effect after a restart.

---

**Note:**  
- This disables the Escape key and makes Caps Lock act as Escape.
- To undo, delete the `Scancode Map` value and restart.

**Backup your registry before making changes.**

toolCallRounds.response:
Yes, you can remap keys using the Windows Registry with **Scancode Map**. Here’s how to remap **Caps Lock** to **Escape** and disable the **Escape** key:

### Steps

1. **Open Registry Editor**  
   Press `Win + R`, type `regedit`, and press Enter.

2. **Navigate to the Key**  
   Go to:  
   ```
   HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Keyboard Layout
   ```

3. **Add Scancode Map**  
   Right-click in the right pane, choose **New > Binary Value**, name it `Scancode Map`.

4. **Set the Value**  
   Double-click `Scancode Map` and enter the following value:

   ```
   00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00
   03 00 00 00
   01 00 3A 00   ; Caps Lock (0x3A) → Escape (0x01)
   00 00 01 00   ; Disable Escape (0x01 → 0x00)
   00 00 00 00   ; End of map
   ```

   In hex (paste into the editor as one line):

   ```
   00000000000000000300000001003A000000010000000000
   ```

5. **Restart Your Computer**  
   Changes take effect after a restart.

---

**Note:**  
- This disables the Escape key and makes Caps Lock act as Escape.
- To undo, delete the `Scancode Map` value and restart.

**Backup your registry before making changes.**

message.text: can u give me the cmd code i just copy and paste

parts.text: can u give me the cmd code i just copy and paste

response.value:
Certainly! You can use the following command in **Command Prompt** (run as Administrator) to add the Scancode Map directly to the registry:

````batch
reg add "HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Keyboard Layout" /v "Scancode Map" /t REG_BINARY /d 00000000000000000300000001003A000000010000000000 /f
````

**After running this command, restart your computer for the changes to take effect.**

**To undo:**  
Delete the value with this command and restart:
````batch
reg delete "HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Keyboard Layout" /v "Scancode Map" /f
````

toolCallRounds.response:
Certainly! You can use the following command in **Command Prompt** (run as Administrator) to add the Scancode Map directly to the registry:

````batch
reg add "HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Keyboard Layout" /v "Scancode Map" /t REG_BINARY /d 00000000000000000300000001003A000000010000000000 /f
````

**After running this command, restart your computer for the changes to take effect.**

**To undo:**  
Delete the value with this command and restart:
````batch
reg delete "HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Keyboard Layout" /v "Scancode Map" /f
````
